page.title: 09ORGANIC FARMING - BARTON FM.
page.content: Almost all the farming in this area relies heavily on the use of inorganic (artificial) fertilizers. However, one farm -{Barton Farm}- believes that too much reliance and usage of such artificial additives are not only unnecessary, but may actually be harmful to long term grazing. Also, artificial nitrogenous additives may poison streams and rivers due to subsequent rainwater run-off. Barton Farm covers 94 acres, of which 7 acres are woodland, 5 acres are arable under potatoes and swedes and the remainder is grassland. To improve the{fertility}of the land, the farm relies on farmyard manure, seaweed,rock phosphate and rock potash. Apart from the small arable acreage, this farm produces fat lambs for human consumption, with less emphasis on rearing calves.
